Yes, employers can track the progress and completion of e-learning courses and certifications taken by their employees. Most e-learning platforms offer tools that track progress and completion, as well as generate reports on employee performance.

To access this information, employers can use learning management systems (LMS) or other tracking software. The LMS allows employers to:

1. Monitor progress: The LMS provides employers with real-time progress on employee training, including the courses and certifications they have completed and how much time they have spent on each course.

2. Analyze performance: Employers can analyze employee performance by generating reports on learning outcomes, learner behavior, and course effectiveness. This information can be used to identify knowledge gaps and areas for improvement and adjust training programs accordingly.

3. Evaluate effectiveness: Employers can evaluate the effectiveness of their e-learning programs by measuring the ROI and the impact of the training on employee performance and productivity.

4. Utilize for performance evaluations and promotions: The information generated by LMS can be used for performance evaluations, promotions, and other talent management purposes. Employers can identify top performers based on their progress and completion of training programs and offer them advancement opportunities.

In conclusion, employers can track the progress and completion of e-learning courses and certifications taken by their employees using LMS and other tracking software. This information can be used to evaluate employee performance, identify areas for improvement, and offer growth opportunities.
